meanings.definition: The state of existing or being real.
meanings.sent1: The actuality of the situation became clear once we saw the evidence.
meanings.sent2: In actuality, the movie was much better than I expected.
meanings.sent3: The actuality of the talking dog made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an actuality that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The actuality of the storm made us seek shelter immediately.

meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being actual or real.
meanings.sent1: The actuality of his words left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent2: The actuality of the painting's beauty was undeniable.
meanings.sent3: The actuality of the cat wearing a hat made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an actuality that touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The actuality of the mountain's grandeur took our breath away.
